author: Pavan Dahat
text:
‘Prabhat Singh was tortured in police custody’

A journalist based in Dantewada district of restive Bastar region of Chhattisgarh was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly writing an objectionable post on a social media group. Prabhat Singh, a journalist of a Hindi newspaper who also contributed stories for a Hindi regional news channel, was allegedly detained by Bastar district police on Monday evening.

“He was forcibly taken away by some policemen who came in a Scorpio vehicle. They did not even allow him to wear his footwear. We had no idea about his whereabouts until he was produced in a court this evening [Tuesday],” Mr. Prabhat Singh’s brother Vishnu Singh told The Hindu .

“Mr. Prabhat Singh was produced before a court in Jagdalpur today [Tuesday]. He is facing four cases including one case under IT Act registered in Parapa police station of Jagdalpur. It is related to some of his comments on a social networking group and he was arrested in the same case. He was remanded in judicial custody until March 30,” informed the journalist’s lawyer Kshitij Dube.
title: Bastar journalist held for social media post
